00055 /**************************  SeeR INFO ***********************************/
00056 #define SeeR_VERSION          95    /* SeeR_VERSION/100.0 */
00057 #define SeeR_VERSION_STR      "0.95a"
00058 #define SeeR_DATE             20020801  /* yyyymmdd */

00065     typedef char *scScript;
00066 
00067 /*
00068    Here you can check some information on current state of SeeR.
00069    e.g.
00070    printf("%d lines compiled.\n",scSeeR_Get(scSeeR_LinesCompiled));
00071 */
00072 /* Get Only */
00073 #define scSeeR_Version            0 /* Returns SeeR_VERSION */
00074 
00075 #define scSeeR_Build              1 /* Build version, returns: */
00076 #define scSeeR_Build_Release      1 /* SeeR may not debug, but is fastest */
00077 #define scSeeR_Build_Debug        2 /* if SeeR may generate debug files */
00078 
00079 #define scSeeR_LinesCompiled      2 /* Number of lines compiled recently */
00080 #define scSeeR_ParamCount         3 /* Size in bytes of parameters passed to imported function */
00081 
00082 /* Set/Get */
00083 #define scSeeR_SafeMode           1000  /* SG If SeeR restricts user from using some     */
00084     /*
00085      * unsafe features (like pointers - in future)
00086      */
00087     /*
00088      * UNIMPLEMENTED
00089      */
00090 #define scSeeR_Debugging          1001  /* SG If debugging is on                         */
00091 #define scSeeR_OpenDebug          1002  /* S  Open debug file, debugging on,             */
00092     /*
00093      * parameter:filename
00094      */
00095 #define scSeeR_CloseDebug         1003  /* S  Close file,Stop debugging                  */
00096 #define scSeeR_Dispatcher         1004  /* SG function dispatcher,                       */
00097     /*
00098      * parameters:
00099      */
00100     /*
00101      * int nr,scFunctionDispatcher fun
00102      */
00103 #define scSeeR_ProgressCallback   1005  /* SG progress callback                          */
00104     /*
00105      * parameter:
00106      */
00107     /*
00108      * int (*fun)(int percent)
00109      */
00110 #define scSeeR_ExprOpcode         1100  /* SG output statement separator opcode (EXPR)?  */
00111     /*
00112      * false - is faster, but in multitasking script
00113      */
00114     /*
00115      * may not be interrupted every X instructions
00116      */
00117     /*
00118      * parameter:
00119      */
00120     /*
00121      * bool EXPR
00122      */
00123     /*
00124      * default:false
00125      */
00126 #define scSeeR_StackSize          1101  /* SG set stack size in bytes                    */
00127     /*
00128      * parameter:
00129      */
00130     /*
00131      * int stack_size_in_bytes
00132      */
00133     /*
00134      * default:4000
00135      */
00136 #define scSeeR_GlobalExpression   1201  /* SG global expressions allowed                 */
00137     /*
00138      * parameter:
00139      */
00140     /*
00141      * bool allowed
00142      */
00143     /*
00144      * default:true
00145      */
00146     int scSeeR_Get ( int, ... );    //these "..." reserved for future parameters
00147     bool scSeeR_Set ( int, ... );   //returns true, if set successful
00148 
00149     void scInit_SeeR ( void );

00155     typedef struct scFlags
00156     {
00157         int priority;
00158         int forkno;             //0 if not a forked instance
00159         int speed;
00160         int paused;
00161     } scFlags;
00162 
00163     typedef struct scInstance
00164     {
00165         scScript code;
00166         char *data_stack;       //here, first 256 ints are registers,then data, then stack
00167         scFlags flags;
00168         struct scInstance *forks, *next_fork, *forked;
00169         struct scInstance *next;
00170     } scInstance;
00171 
00172     typedef struct scScheduler
00173     {
00174         scInstance *first;
00175     } scScheduler;
00176 
00177 //Script type info
00178     typedef struct
00179     {
00180         int regDS;              //for variable access-the address of global variables
00181         scInstance *ins;        //the instance script is refering to
00182         int reserved;
00183     } scScriptTypeHeader;

00187 #define scDispatch_Void         ((unsigned)1<<21)
00188 #define scDispatch_Struct       ((unsigned)((1<<24)|(1<<23)|(1<<22)))
00189 #define scDispatch_Script       ((unsigned)1<<25)
00190 #define scDispatch_Double       ((unsigned)1<<26)
00191 #define scDispatch_Member       ((unsigned)1<<27)
00192     typedef void ( *scFunctionDispatcher ) ( int *result, void *function, int *params, int paramcount, /*void *_this, */ unsigned int options );
00193     void scStandardDispatcher ( int *result, void *function, int *params, int paramcount, unsigned int options );
00194     void scCDispatcher ( int *result, void *function, int *params, int paramcount, unsigned int options );

00305 /*********************PRIORITIES*****************************************/
00306     EXTERN bool scIgnore_Rights;
00307     void scSet_Priority ( scInstance *, int priority_level );
00308     int scGet_Priority ( scInstance * );    //if NULL returns scNONE
00309     int scGet_Actual_Priority (  );
00310 
00311 //These macros are to check if an instance calling a function containing
00312 //them has at least required priority - if not it'll set
00313 //an error and return rets (if function returns void, rets should be `;')
00314 #define scPriorityGuard(priority,rets) \
00315         if ((scGet_Actual_Priority()<priority)&&!scIgnore_Rights)\
00316         {\
00317         scRuntime_Error("Priority violation at instance `%s'",\
00318         scGet_Instance_Title(scActual_Instance));\
00319         scErrorNo=scErr_Violation; return rets;\
00320         }
00321 
00322 #define scKernelOnly(rets) scPriorityGuard(scrights_KERNEL,rets);
00323

00413 /*********************C++ INTERFACE**************************************/
00414     enum
00415     { scriptLoad, scriptCompileFile, scriptCompileText };
00416 
00417     class seerScript
00418     {
00419       protected:
00420         scScript script;
00421       public:
00422 
00423         seerScript (  ):script ( NULL )
00424         {
00425         }
00426 
00427         seerScript ( int a, char *text ):script ( NULL )
00428         {
00429             switch ( a )
00430             {
00431                 case scriptLoad:
00432                     script = scLoad_Script ( text );
00433                     break;
00434                     case scriptCompileText:script = scCompile_Text ( text );
00435                     break;
00436                     case scriptCompileFile:script = scCompile_File ( text );
00437                     break;
00438             }
00439         }
00440 
00441          ~seerScript (  )
00442         {                       /*free(); */
00443         }
00444 
00445         void free ( void )
00446         {
00447             if ( script )
00448                 scFree_Script ( script );
00449         }
00450 
00451         int size ( void )
00452         {
00453             return scGet_Script_Size ( script );
00454         }
00455 
00456         char *title ( void )
00457         {
00458             return scGet_Title ( script );
00459         }
00460 
00461         char *author ( void )
00462         {
00463             return scGet_Author ( script );
00464         }
00465 
00466         scScript get ( void )
00467         {
00468             return script;
00469         }
00470 
00471         int compileFile ( char *filename )
00472         {
00473             script = scCompile_File ( filename );
00474             return scErrorNo;
00475         }
00476 
00477         int compileText ( char *text )
00478         {
00479             script = scCompile_Text ( text );
00480             return scErrorNo;
00481         }
00482 
00483         bool load ( char *filename )
00484         {
00485             script = scLoad_Script ( filename );
00486             return script != NULL;
00487         }
00488 
00489         bool valid (  )
00490         {
00491             if ( !script || !size (  ) )
00492                 return false;
00493             return true;
00494         }
00495     };
00496 
00497 #define seerVar(inst,adr,typ) (*(typ*)inst.var(adr))
00498 #define seerNameVar(ins,name,typ) (*(typ*)inst.var(name))
00499 
00500     class seerInstance
00501     {
00502       protected:
00503         scInstance * ins;
00504       public:
00505 
00506         seerInstance (  )
00507         {
00508             ins = NULL;
00509         }
00510 
00511         seerInstance ( scScript sc )
00512         {
00513             ins = scCreate_Instance ( sc, "" );
00514         }
00515 
00516         seerInstance ( scInstance * i )
00517         {
00518             ins = i;
00519         }
00520 //  seerInstance(seerInstance& i) //make fork
00521 //    {ins=scFork_Instance(i.ins);}
00522 
00523         void free ( void )
00524         {
00525             if ( ins )
00526                 scFree_Instance ( ins );
00527         }
00528 
00529         ~seerInstance (  )
00530         {                       /*free(); */
00531         }
00532 
00533 
00534         scInstance *get ( void )
00535         {
00536             return ins;
00537         }
00538 
00539         int symbol ( char *s )
00540         {
00541             return scGet_Symbol ( ins, s );
00542         }
00543 
00544         int status ( void )
00545         {
00546             return scGet_Instance_Status ( ins );
00547         }
00548 
00549         char *title (  )
00550         {
00551             return scGet_Instance_Title ( ins );
00552         }
00553 
00554         int create ( seerScript & sc )
00555         {
00556             return ( int ) ( ins = scCreate_Instance ( sc.get (  ), "" ) );
00557         }
00558 
00559         int call ( int addr, ... )
00560         {
00561             va_list va;
00562                         int *params = NULL;
00563             va_start ( va, addr );
00564                         params = &( va_arg ( va, int ) );
00565                         va_end(va);
00566             return scVCall_Instance ( ins, addr, -1, params );
00567             //-1 - default number of parameters
00568         }
00569 
00570         int call ( char *_symbol, ... )
00571         {
00572             va_list va;
00573                         int *params = NULL;
00574             va_start ( va, _symbol );
00575                         params = &( va_arg ( va, int ) );
00576                         va_end(va);
00577             return scVCall_Instance ( ins, symbol ( _symbol ), -1, params );
00578         }
00579 
00580         int start (  )
00581         {
00582             return call ( "main" );
00583         }
00584 
00585         int vcall ( int address, int paramc, int *params )
00586         {
00587             return scVCall_Instance ( ins, address, paramc, params );
00588         }
00589 
00590         int vlaunch ( int spd, int address, int paramc, int *params )
00591         {
00592             return scVLaunch_Instance ( ins, spd, address, paramc, params );
00593         }
00594 
00595         int launch ( int spd, int addr, ... )
00596         {
00597             va_list va;
00598                         int *params = NULL;
00599             va_start ( va, addr );
00600                         params = &( va_arg ( va, int ) );
00601                         va_end(va);
00602             return scVLaunch_Instance ( ins, spd, addr, -1, params );
00603         }
00604 
00605         int launch ( int spd, char *_symbol, ... )
00606         {
00607             va_list va;
00608                         int *params = NULL;
00609             va_start ( va, _symbol );
00610                         params = &( va_arg ( va, int ) );
00611                         va_end(va);
00612             return scVLaunch_Instance ( ins, spd, symbol ( _symbol ), -1, params );
00613         }
00614 
00615         void pause ( int p )
00616         {
00617             scPause_Instance ( ins, p );
00618         }
00619 
00620         void kill (  )
00621         {
00622             scKill_Instance ( ins );
00623         }
00624 
00625         scInstance *forked ( int i )
00626         {
00627             return scGet_Forked ( ins, i );
00628         }
00629 
00630         void killForked (  )
00631         {
00632             scKill_Forked_Instances ( ins );
00633         }
00634 
00635         void *var ( char *name )    //returns pointer to variable
00636         {
00637             return var ( symbol ( name ) );
00638         }
00639 
00640         void *var ( int offset )    //returns pointer to variable
00641         {
00642             if ( offset == -1 )
00643                 return NULL;
00644             return ( void * ) ( ins->data_stack + 256 * 4 + offset );
00645         }
00646 
00647         bool valid (  )
00648         {
00649             return ( ins != NULL && scGet_Script_Size ( ins->code ) );
00650         }
00651     };
00652 
00653 #ifndef SC_STRING_UNUSED
00654 
00655     class seerString:public scintString
00656     {
00657       public:
00658 // char *cstr;
00659 
00660 // seerString(char *x) {string_string_char(this,x);}
00661 // seerString(int x) {string_string_int(this,x);}
00662 // seerString(const seerString& f) {string_copy(this,(seerString*)&f);}
00663 // seerString() {string_string(this);}
00664 
00665         seerString & operator= ( int x )
00666         {
00667             return *( seerString * ) ( string_operatorSET_int ( this, x ) );
00668         }
00669 // {return /*(seerString&)*/(*string_operatorSET_int(this,x));}
00670 /*  {seerString& sS;
00671    sS=(seerString&)(*string_operatorSET_int(this,x));
00672    return sS;
00673    }*/
00674 
00675         seerString ( const char *s )
00676         {
00677             string_string_char ( this, s );
00678         }
00679 
00680         seerString & operator= ( seerString & s )
00681         {
00682             return ( seerString & ) * string_operatorSET ( this, &s );
00683         }
00684         seerString & operator= ( char *s )
00685         {
00686             return ( seerString & ) * string_operatorSET_char ( this, s );
00687         }
00688 // a=x=s; <=> a.operator=(x.operator=(s));
00689 
00690 // seerString operator+(seerString& x) {return *(seerString*)&string_operatorPLUS(this,&x);}
00691 // seerString operator+(char *s) {return *(seerString*)&string_operatorPLUS_char(this,s);}

00701         }
00702 // a=x+s; <=> a=x.operator+(s); <=> a.operator=(x.operator+(s));
